title: Drawing, Harold S. Anderson House: Master Bedroom- Switch/Bellbox, September 13, 1937
title_raw: Harold S. Anderson House: Master Bedroom- Switch/Bellbox
medium: graphite and black ink on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, center left: SWITCH BOX/ INSTALLATION OF SWITCH & BELL BOX/REMOVE BACK OF NIGHT CABINET/FASTEN SWITCH BOX TO REMOVABLE/PANEL "A" AND PLACE BELL BOX/AS SHOWN ON OUR DRAW. NO./8589 - REV; inscribed below drawing at left: PHONE FASTENED/TO SLIDE FROM UNDERNEATH; lower right under stamp: SENT TO ANDERSON 9/13/37
description: Perspective drawing of night table with switch and bell box. Cabinet with rounded right corner; door on right side. Phone installed at left of cabinet below; phone fastened to slide. Switch box on left side above space for phone.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, Harold S. Anderson House: Master Bedroom- Switch/Bellbox, September 13, 1937; Office of Donald Deskey Associates ; USA; graphite and black ink on tracing paper; H x W: 39.4 x 48.9 cm (15 1/2 x 19 1/4 in.); Gift of Donald Deskey; 1975-11-951
